README.md
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 ## Description
2 
3 This package is developed based on the package
4 [or_octomap](https://github.com/personalrobotics/or_octomap), which can be used
5 to give octomap support to OpenRAVE. General information about OctoMap is
6 available [here](https://octomap.github.io/). More information about the octomap
7 pipeline in ROS can be found at http://wiki.ros.org/octomap.
8 
9 ## Travis - Continuous Integration
10 [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/crigroup/or_octomap_plugin.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/crigroup/or_octomap_plugin)
11 
12 ## Documentation
13 
14 * Throughout the various files in this repository.
15 * `or_octomap_plugin` documentation: https://crigroup.github.io/or_octomap_plugin/
16 
17 ## Run
18 Once the camera is launched and the point cloud topic is being published, the octomap can be created by running:
19 ```
20 rosrun or_octomap_plugin octomap_creation.py
21 ```
22 In order to successfully create the octomap, some command line parameters need to be set correctly:
23 ```
24 Parameters:
25 --file-name : File name for the generated octomap. Default=octomap.
26 --topic : Point cloud topic name. Default=/camera/depth/points.
27 --frame : The frame name of the octomap. Default=map.
28 --range : Max range of the input point cloud (m). Default=2.0
29 --resolution: Leaf cube size (mm) of the octomap. Default=0.005
30 --timeout : Timeout (s) for the octomap creation. Default=10
31 ```
32 
33 ## Test results
34 Some test results working with the ensenso camera, can be found at [wiki/Test-Results](https://github.com/crigroup/or_octomap_plugin/wiki/Test-Results)
35 
36 ## Note
37 When the octomap is created, there is some annoying info `Writing 181520 nodes to output stream...` keep publishing, which could not be stopped from the command or code. The most efficient way to stop it is to add the following line `#define NDEBUG` to the file `/opt/ros/kinetic/include/octomap/octomap_types.h`, which would look like:
38 ```c++
39 #define NDEBUG
40 // no debug output if not in debug mode:
41 #ifdef NDEBUG
42  #ifndef OCTOMAP_NODEBUGOUT
43  #define OCTOMAP_NODEBUGOUT
44  #endif
45 #endif
46 ```
47 #### Collision Checking
48 When `or_octomap` is created and enabled, `or_octomap_checker` will be set as the collision checker of OpenRAVE. When this is done, all collision checks get tested against the octomap before they are tested against other OpenRAVE kinbodies. In experiments, `fcl` collision checker is still at least ten times faster than the `or_octomap_checker`, therefore it is recommanded to load the generated octomap mesh file into OpenRAVE, and use `fcl` to make collision check.
